intro: Gilia aurea f. pallescens, commonly known as the pale golden gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. The pale golden gilia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
